Title.evidence: The DAVE RCT aimed to determine whether DCD is an effective, safe, and cost-effective treatment adjunct for VLUs.

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients were randomized to either the intervention (DCD graft and standard of care) or control arm (standard of care alone).

Participants.evidence: Patients with lower limb ulcers ≥18 years with VLU, venous incompetence on duplex ultrasound, an ankle : brachial pressure index ≥ 0.8 and an index VLU present for at least 3 months and ≥2 cm 2 in size were included.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomized to either the intervention (DCD graft and standard of care) or control arm (standard of care alone).

Objective.evidence: The DAVE RCT aimed to determine whether DCD is an effective, safe, and cost-effective treatment adjunct for VLUs.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the proportion of patients with a healed index ulcer at 12 weeks.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From October 2019 to October 2022, 36 and 35 participants were randomized into the intervention and control arms respectively.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Patient characteristics at baseline were similar between groups.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Healing was recorded in 5.7% of the intervention group and 15.2% in the control group (OR 0.34, 95% c.i. 0.03 to 2.31).

Harms.evidence: There were five serious adverse events attributed to DCD application.
